name: Cradlepoint NetCloud
description: Cradlepoint cellular router monitoring via API. 40 alert types covering signal, connectivity, WAN failover, GPS, and device status.
author: OpsConductor

alerts.title: Gps Antenna Fault
alerts.description: GPS antenna fault detected. Check antenna connection and cable.

alerts.title: Gps Fix Acquired
alerts.description: GPS has acquired satellite fix. Location tracking operational.

alerts.title: Gps Fix Lost
alerts.description: GPS has lost satellite fix. Location tracking unavailable. May affect location-based services.

alerts.title: Temperature Critical
alerts.description: Device internal temperature is critically high (>70°C). Risk of thermal shutdown. Improve ventilation immediately.

alerts.title: Temperature High
alerts.description: Device temperature is elevated (>60°C). Monitor closely and improve airflow if possible.

alerts.title: Temperature Normal
alerts.description: Device temperature has returned to normal operating range.

alerts.title: Device Offline
alerts.description: Router is not responding to API requests. Device may be powered off, rebooting, or network path is broken.

alerts.title: Device Offline
alerts.description: Router offline

alerts.title: Device Online
alerts.description: Router is back online and responding to API requests.

alerts.title: Device Online
alerts.description: Router online

alerts.title: Device Rebooting
alerts.description: Router is rebooting. Temporary loss of connectivity expected.

alerts.title: Device Uptime Reset
alerts.description: Device uptime has reset, indicating a recent reboot. Check if planned or unexpected.

alerts.title: Ethernet Link Down
alerts.description: Ethernet port link is down. Connected device may be offline or cable disconnected.

alerts.title: Ethernet Link Up
alerts.description: Ethernet port link is up.

alerts.title: Wan All Down
alerts.description: All WAN connections are down. Device has no internet connectivity. Critical for remote sites.

alerts.title: Wan Failover
alerts.description: Primary WAN has failed, traffic has failed over to backup connection (cellular or secondary). Investigate primary WAN failure.

alerts.title: Wan Failover
alerts.description: WAN failover active

alerts.title: Wan Primary Down
alerts.description: Primary WAN interface is down. If failover is configured, backup should be active.

alerts.title: Wan Restored
alerts.description: Primary WAN connection restored. Traffic returning to primary path.

alerts.title: Wan Restored
alerts.description: WAN primary restored

alerts.title: Carrier Change
alerts.description: Cellular carrier has changed. May indicate roaming or carrier switching.

alerts.title: Connection Connecting
alerts.description: Cellular modem is attempting to connect. Normal during startup or after signal loss.

alerts.title: Connection Error
alerts.description: Cellular modem encountered a connection error. May be authentication, SIM, or carrier issue. Check modem diagnostics.

alerts.title: Connection Lost
alerts.description: Cellular modem has lost connection to the carrier network. No WAN connectivity via cellular. Check SIM, carrier status, and signal.

alerts.title: Connection Lost
alerts.description: Cellular connection lost

alerts.title: Connection Restored
alerts.description: Cellular connection has been restored. WAN connectivity is operational.

alerts.title: Connection Restored
alerts.description: Cellular connection restored

alerts.title: Modem Error
alerts.description: Cellular modem has encountered an error. May require reboot or hardware attention.

alerts.title: Modem Firmware Mismatch
alerts.description: Modem firmware version mismatch detected. May need firmware update.

alerts.title: Modem Reset
alerts.description: Cellular modem has been reset. Temporary connectivity loss expected.

alerts.title: Signal Critical
alerts.description: Cellular signal critical

alerts.title: Signal Critical
alerts.description: Cellular signal strength is critically low (RSRP ≤ -110 dBm or RSSI ≤ -95 dBm). Data connectivity is severely degraded or lost. Check antenna connections, relocate device, or investigate RF interference.

alerts.title: Signal Low
alerts.description: Cellular signal low

alerts.title: Signal Low
alerts.description: Cellular signal strength is below optimal (RSRP ≤ -100 dBm or RSSI ≤ -85 dBm). Data throughput may be reduced. Monitor for further degradation.

alerts.title: Signal Normal
alerts.description: Cellular signal strength has returned to acceptable levels. Previous signal alerts should auto-resolve.

alerts.title: Signal Normal
alerts.description: Cellular signal normal

alerts.title: Sim Error
alerts.description: SIM card error detected. Check SIM is properly inserted and activated.

alerts.title: Sim Not Present
alerts.description: No SIM card detected in modem. Insert valid SIM card.

alerts.title: Sinr Critical
alerts.description: Signal-to-Interference-plus-Noise Ratio is critically low (SINR ≤ 0 dB). Severe interference affecting data quality. Check for RF interference sources.

alerts.title: Sinr Low
alerts.description: SINR is below optimal (SINR ≤ 5 dB). Some interference present, may affect throughput.

clear_events.description: Alerts auto-resolve when condition no longer detected
